name: Snail Cam
description:
The Snail cams are sold individually so you can mix and match to perfect your set-up. This also means you don't have to buy a pair if you have only damaged one of your existing snail cams.

Available in either the Light alloy version or the steel version

The Snail cams are 12mm but will still work on a 10mm axle.

Supplied individually, allowing you to choose the best snail cam arrangement for your set-up:

2 x Steel cams for the most durable set-up

1 x Steel cam drive-side for durability with 1 x Light cam non-drive side to save weight

2 x Light cams for the lightest possible set-up

Available in Fluorescent green, black and silver in both steel and aluminium 

Weight (per cam): Light - 7g. Steel - 18g.

name: Quarter Bash Ring
description:
Super lightweight bash ring to fit all screw-on cranks.

This bashring is constructed from laser cut 6082 T6 aluminiumum with a polished then anodised finish.

This bashring can be fitted for either left or right footed riders and can be used with any freewheel.

The bashring is 5mm in depth across the whole surface.

This product can only be used with 18 tooth freewheels or smaller.

Supplied with a 1mm freewheel spacer.

Available in Red, Green, Blue, Gold, Purple.

Weight:

22g
